etymologies: late 17th century (in bergamot (sense 2)): named after the city and province of Bergamo in northern Italy

definitions: an oily substance extracted from the rind of the fruit of a dwarf variety of the Seville orange tree. It is used in cosmetics and as flavoring in tea.
shortDefinitions: oily substance extracted from rind of dwarf variety of Seville orange

definitions: the tree which bears a variety of Seville orange from which bergamot is extracted.

notes.text: Citrus aurantium subsp. bergamia, family Rutaceae

shortDefinitions: tree which bears variety of Seville orange from which bergamot is extracted

crossReferenceMarkers: Also called bee balm, Oswego tea
definitions: an aromatic North American herb of the mint family.
shortDefinitions: aromatic North American herb of mint family

etymologies: early 17th century: from French bergamotte, from Italian bergamotta, from Turkish begarmudu ‘prince's pear’, from beg ‘prince’ + armud ‘pear’ + the possessive suffix -u

definitions: a dessert pear of a rich and sweet variety.
shortDefinitions: dessert pear of rich and sweet variety
